message.content:
cs.NE, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY, q-bio.NC

Reasoning: The paper discusses the development of a spiking Neuronal-Astrocytic Network (SNAN) on Intel's Loihi neuromorphic chip, which falls under the category of computational neuroscience and neuromorphic engineering. The paper also discusses the functional role of astrocytes in SNAN, including synchronization, plasticity, and the transition between ordered and chaotic activity, which are all relevant to the sub-categories of neural networks (cs.NE), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper explores the potential applications of the astrocytic module in real-world scenarios, which falls under the sub-category of systems and control (cs.SY). Finally, the paper discusses the biological aspects of astrocytes and their role in forming biological intelligence, which could potentially fall under the sub-category of quantitative biology (q-bio.NC).
